title: Implement Centralized Logging with ELK Stack
description: Implement centralized logging using the ELK stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana).

effort_estimate.justification: Centralized logging is essential for troubleshooting and analyzing application behavior.

user_stories: As a developer, I want to search and analyze logs so that I can quickly identify and resolve issues.
business_rules: All application logs must be collected and stored in Elasticsearch.
Logstash must be configured to parse and enrich logs.
Kibana dashboards must be created to visualize log data.
edge_cases: Managing high volumes of log data.

acceptance_criteria: Elasticsearch cluster is running and storing logs.
Logstash is configured to parse and enrich logs.
Kibana dashboards are created and displaying log data.
Filebeat is configured to ship logs to Logstash.

additional_context.technical_notes: Ensure ELK stack is properly configured and integrated with the application.
additional_context.security_considerations: Secure the ELK stack to prevent unauthorized access to log data.
